name: The Lightkeepers Inn

reviews.text: The Lightkeepers Inn has 5 rooms and a cottage, all equipped with bedroom, bathroom, and a delightful little living, dining, kitchen area. It is very well equipped (they even provide half-n-half in the refrigerator) and it is exceptionally clean. You feel as though you were the first peson to stay there. The two drawbacks to this location are that it's about 6 feet from the road that serves as overflow for cars trying to get on the Chappy ferry. The other is that it's an old house and sound carries easily. I imagine the second floor in the back is probably the quietest location -- if I come here again, I'll try booking the cottage or Suite 5; after that I'd choose a room in descending order, Suite 1 being the noisiest. They do everything within their power to make it a delightful stay. I would recommend it.
reviews.title: Clean and comfortable, a little noisy

reviews.title: Loved it – location!
reviews.text: The Lightkeeper's Inn is located on Simpson St. in Edgartown and has five rooms in the main house and a detached cottage known as the Lightkeeper's Cottage, which is nearby the main house. On site parking is included at no extra charge. (I imagine this is a big deal during the height of the season). We stayed in the cottage.

The purpose of our visit in mid-March 2007 was a "birthday-girls weekend out" with my sister and mom. Since our birthdays are close together and we thought it would be a great way to celebrate my big #40 milestone by going to Martha's Vineyard, a place we've always wanted to visit.
reviews.title: Nice, but small
Superb Living in Edgartown
reviews.text: As someone who tries to avoid flowery adjectives and hyperbole, let me just say that The Lightkeeper's Inn was a delight, plain and simple. Everything was perfect. Everything is quality, and everything is incredibly clean. All this thanks to our gracious Innkeeper Pat and her staff, whom it's clear put great importance in all of the above. We even misbooked our stay, accidently booking the cottage for the following weekend. It was our error, not the Inn's, however we were accommodated without delay or any of the issues you might otherwise encounter with another inn or motel. In fact, upon our arrival, I was very surprised to find a box of Chilmark Chocolates (only available on the west-side of the island, we were told) and a postcard wishing me a happy birthday. Now that's fantastic service! And fantastic chocolate, btw. Worth the trip across the island.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our stay at the Lightkeeper's Inn started out perfectly -- nice little suite, seemingly very private, and a half-bottle of champagne from the owners (whom we never met) to help celebrate our anniversary. But then I had the worst night's sleep of my life. We stayed in the Cape Pogue Suite, on the ground floor towards the back, and just outside the bedroom window was the loudest ice machine imaginable -- so loud it might as well have been in the room, and totally unnecessary, as each room has its own fridge with ice trays. I spent eight hours listening to the machine go on and off (when I reached my limit & turned it off around 1.30, someone turned it back on half an hour later), when not distracted by every sound made by the couple in the room above, or by the very bouncy mattress which meant that every time my husband moved, I woke up. And I'm not a light sleeper. And after a long sleepless night, there was no hint of breakfast, which made for a strange contradiction between motor-lodge experience and boutique hotel prices. We chose the Lightkeeper's inn because of the great reviews on this site, but having seen the other hotels in Edgartown (the Harborview, Edgartown Inn etc.), all of which had better September rates, I'm kicking myself. Maybe the other suites are better, but this was a very dark spot in an otherwise lovely trip to the Vineyard.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Everything about our visit was perfect, due in large part to the fact that our lodging situation was ideal. The Inn is absolutely charming and our room was immaculate. It is perfectly located off of the downtown Edgartown shopping and dining area, which made walking to restaurants and shops extremely easy.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Most importantly, Doreen, the Inn Manager, was a true delight. She met us at the Inn even though we arrived well before check-in time (we took a red-eye flight into Boston and then an early morning puddle jumper directly on to the island) and allowed us to store our luggage in the entry area until the room was ready. The she invited us back to the Inn's main business office just down the road to freshen up and change clothes. Upon our day of departure, she likewise let us store our things while we did some last minute sightseeing and even ran back to the room once we had checked out to retrieve my friend's forgotten cell phone! She truly made our visit memorable with her kindess and genuine interest in our happiness.

reviews.title: Lovely Edgartown

aka: The Lightkeepers Inn Edgartown, MA - Martha's Vineyard
description: The Lightkeepers Inn is nestled in the heart of historic Edgartown and is within walking distance to Lighthouse Beach and Edgartown Harbor, and just steps away from fine boutiques, galleries, restaurants, movies and parks that line the charming village streets. The Lightkeepers Inn is comprised of a private cottage and five suites. Each suite has a bedroom and a second room that has dining, living and kitchen areas. Complimentary on site parking and wireless high-speed internet.
